pneumatic caisson.gloss: large watertight chamber used for construction under water

pneumatic hammer.gloss: a hammer driven by compressed air

pneumatic tire.gloss: a tire made of reinforced rubber and filled with compressed air

pneumatic tyre.gloss: a tire made of reinforced rubber and filled with compressed air

pneumococcal vaccine.gloss: vaccine (trade name Pneumovax) effective against the 23 most common strains of pneumococcus

pneumococcus.gloss: bacterium causing pneumonia in mice and humans

pneumoconiosis.gloss: chronic respiratory disease caused by inhaling metallic or mineral particles

pneumocystis carinii pneumonia.gloss: pneumonia occurring in infants or in persons with impaired immune systems (as AIDS victims)

pneumocystis pneumonia.gloss: pneumonia occurring in infants or in persons with impaired immune systems (as AIDS victims)

pneumocytosis.gloss: pneumonia occurring in infants or in persons with impaired immune systems (as AIDS victims)

pneumoencephalogram.gloss: an X ray of the brain made by replacing spinal fluid with a gas (usually oxygen) to improve contrast

pneumogastric.gloss: of or relating to the vagus nerve

pneumogastric nerve.gloss: a mixed nerve that supplies the pharynx and larynx and lungs and heart and esophagus and stomach and most of the abdominal viscera

pneumonic plague.gloss: a rapidly progressive and frequently fatal form of the plague that can spread through the air from person to person

pneumonoconiosis.gloss: chronic respiratory disease caused by inhaling metallic or mineral particles

pneumovax.gloss: vaccine (trade name Pneumovax) effective against the 23 most common strains of pneumococcus

pnom penh.gloss: the capital and largest city of Kampuchea

pneumonic.gloss: relating to or affecting the lungs
